conclusion: Analyze processes from state A to state C to determine temperature at state C.
A to B is an isobaric process, B to C is an isothermal process, C to D is an isochoric process.
Pressure remains constant at 4 atm from A to B, volume increases from 10 L to 20 L.
Relate temperatures at A and B using ideal gas law, since pressure is constant, V is proportional to T.
Calculate T_B using V_A = 10 L, T_A = 300 K, V_B = 20 L, resulting in T_B = 600 K.
In isothermal process B to C, temperature remains constant, so T_B = T_C = 600 K.
Temperature of the gas in state C is 600 K.
